Instruction: Combine milk and vinegar in a small bowl; let it sit until it curdles, approximately 10 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit (200 degrees Celsius) and use a small amount of oil to grease a baking sheet.

Combine flour, sugar, baking soda, and salt in a mixing bowl. Gradually add the soured milk and mix until the dough just comes together. Transfer the dough to a surface dusted with flour, gently knead, and shape it into a round form.
Cut an "X" into the top of the dough to help release steam and maintain the round shape while baking, then transfer to the prepared baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until the loaf turns golden brown and sounds hollow when tapped at the bottom, approximately 45 minutes.
